response_parsed.title: Deploying REST APIs using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will walk you through the process of creating and deploying a REST API using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is built on top of Starlette, an ASGI web server for building web applications.
It provides automatic documentation using OpenAPI and JSON Schema specifications.
Supports multiple databases like SQLAlchemy, Motor, SQLite, and more.
Includes type hints and PEP 524 support for better development experience.
Offers fast performance thanks to its use of Python type hints.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required to use FastAPI.
For Uvicorn (an ASGI server for FastAPI) support, make sure you have Python 3.8.5 or higher.
caveats: Some features like AsyncContext and CORS may require a specific version of Python greater than 3.12.
For production deployment, consider using Uvicorn as the ASGI server.
